Reviews.Title: “Good location is about it”
Reviews.Author: Saffa-Mich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Rome marathon weekend, we wanted something cheap with friends. Simple and basic is what we got! Getting up to the hotel was an adventure in its self, in the tiny 'wood look' closet like elevator! We booked a quad which was the same size as a regular double room, when we entered the room it looked like it was just one big bed as there was barely space to walk between the beds. The beds were ok, our room had mustard bedspreads, the bathroom was tiny and our toilet didn't flush too well (not too good with four people in the room!) On the positive, the breakfast was free and relatively good for what we were paying. (Pastries, boiled eggs, cold meats, cheese, cereals, tea coffee etc) It is also very close to the Termini station so it is very convenient to get to the the airport. The staff were friendly and there was free wifi in the hotel. Overall I probably wouldn't stay here again as I think you could get better value for money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Shame Wasnt as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: wallaceneuk1
Reviews.Content: Well not one for complaining but here goes. Room -was fine for the purpose Bar as advertised?-there wasnt a bar food-hard cheese,ham.dry bread.cerial,boiled eggs,yoghurt,some fruit was the choice every day we were there for 4 nights 5 days. Lift-as its on the 4th and 5th floor if elderley dont book here as the lift doesnt always work . Security-they have a security guard on main door late at night ,but as I found out he works with a local hood as he allowed him into building at same time as us whowhen just about at reception but in view and with cctv tried robbing me ,got away with my gold chain around my neck and then ran down 4 flights of stairs past security and off,only when I insisted to the guy on reception who wasnt at all interested to get the police did the security guard take an interest and after two atempts at retrieving the said gold chain did i get it back,broken but at least I got it back all was well. Question is how?/ if they wernt working together did they track this down so easily and who did the other chain belong too? Staff- All were pleasant especially the young lass with the longer hair ,except for the rude lady in her thirties with the dark hair? and the porter at night. rest were very nice location-yep nice and handy for everything . Rome absolutely beutifull but now named rip off rome? £10 a beer in most places? ask the price of drinks please before ordering? and beware the bread it costs per head politely say no. Restaurant-opposite the hotel with the tables outside and the friendly waiter we named spider man is great ,have a visit. Mini fridge-says on website its a free mini bar..its not.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: iro-akis k
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing....We went there and we saw nothing like what we saw in the internet.!!!!! The room was very dark,like a cell,no balcony ofcourse and the only view was the back cement walls from the nowhere...No decoration,curtains like a child's handcraft ,poor breakfast. When we complained about our cell-room the receptionist was like we were crazy and didn't know what we were talking about!!!! He said that the room was just the same with the one we saw and he wasn 't even sympathetic with us.He was kind of rude and didn't like it at all. Fortunately a blonde very polite lady the next day gave us another room,not that it was good but it was a little bit better. The only good thing is the location even though quite strange at nights....For the Greeks is like "omonoia"....but the termini was very closed. Finally,if you use a hairdryer don't forget to take your own because this one was like a girl's toy.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly staff, close to Termini station”
Reviews.Author: irina60
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Rome, it was my 3rd stay at Scott House. The hotel is a little more expensive than last year however they have made rennovations and much improved their breakfast service. The hotel is very clean, the staff is friendly and helpful. If you travel solo and if you book in advance, request for rooms 516/517 since are equipped with larger beds and are a little more spacious than the regular single rooms. To add that the location of the hotel suits the traveller perfectly since it is very close to Termini station and one has a wide choice of transportation means : subway, buses, trams. It is also very close to Santa Maria Maggiore and several buses stop right in front of the hotel ( eg bus 70 that connects to downtown - Largo Argentina - return).There are plenty of tourist restaurants and shops in the area, including also fast foods and a super market next to the hotel, plus a bigger supper market just a little down, next to Maggiore. I shall definitely stay in this hotel on my text trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Blissful604
Reviews.Content: Our flight was for next day after our cruise, so we needed a place to stay for one night. Since we were traveling by train, this place was perfect, as it was only about a 5 minute walk from Termini station. The place was not hard to find once you were on the right street. However it was quite a hike up to the 4th floor where the hotel was actually located (each floor had a different hotel). It was only after we dragged our suitcase up, we realized there was a tiny lift (enough for maybe 3 people) with a grey door that looked like it was part of the walls on the 1st floor. We arrived early for our check in, so they provided us with a key to a locker room to store our luggage. The room was actually big with high vaulted ceiling. It was very basic with a phone, small TV, A/C, and fridge. You had to check out the remote for both the TV and A/C at the front desk. The bed was okay, but it didn't really have any blanket, it was more like a thick sheet. They also had free Wi-Fi, since our room was close to the front desk, it had pretty good signal. Because our flight was really early, we would miss the include breakfast. However the front desk was quite nice and packed us a breakfast instead. It included croissant, nutella, yogurt, biscuit and juice. Overall, this was a basic hotel that was worth the price for our one night stay

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a night, close by the train station.”
Reviews.Author: coantrimtripadviser
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel room for a one night stay in Rome on 21st October, somewhere close to the railway station and chose the Scott House Hotel, after reading various hotel reviews on tripadvisor. First impressions are not good as the hotel entrance is via a rather dodgy looking hallway, guarded by a few odd looking characters standing on the pavement beside a number of rubbish bags. To be fair, the rubbish bags were lifted soon after when we went for a walk that afternoon. The street wasn't as bad as we first thought and we soon felt a bit easier with the location, knowing it was only for one night anyway. The actual hotel reception is on the fourth floor, accessed by a very small lift. The reception desk is also very small, however the staff are polite and helpful and our front facing room was clean and tidy, if a bit sparse in decor. The room was a good size with a clean practical bathroom, the shower was brilliant. We soon left for a walk in the city centre, which took a leisurely 30 minutes or so and had a lovely evening enjoying everything that Rome has to offer. We returned around ten and went to bed feeling rather tired, having travelled down from Milan by train that morning, which is a lovely journey in itself. The only draw back in having a front facing room, is the noise from the street, which does not stop until late on about 3am. Breakfast was surprisingly nice, with cereals and pastries, which suited me perfectly. We were able to leave our luggage in a store room after we checked out which gave us another day to enjoy Rome, before catching the train to the airport, for our flight home. The Scott House Hotel is about 200 metres from the train station and does what it says on the tin! It is very basic, yet provides an adequate hotel room for a one or at most, two night stay in Rome. Don't expect any luxuries, just put your head down after a busy day and try to get a good nights sleep. The great thing is you don't have far to pull that heavy suitcase before boarding the train for the next part of your journey. All in all, not as bad as we thought when we first arrived and if we needed a room close to Rome station again, I would probably go back but would ask for a rear facing room. At the end of the day, it was a room at a price and we knew that before we set foot inside the Scott House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Heli30
Reviews.Content: The best about this hotel is its location. Very easy to get from airport (by train) and very convenient to explore the city. 15 min to Colosseum etc. Neighborhood not the most beautiful, but many restaurants nearby and also good supermarket next to the basilica. Friendly service at the hotel, rooms clean, towels changed daily. Good! Rooms and specially the bathroom rather small but manageable. Breakfast ok, nothing special but adequate start for the day. Note that breakfast room is too small, it is likely that you have to wait for the table. Overall, I would recommend this hotel (as long as you not planning to stay in the room) as it is clean, good location and good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Basic budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: gwenkay
Reviews.Content: It is expensive to stay in Rome but this hotel has more reasonable rates. It is two blocks from the main train station so it's convenient although not the most interesting part of the city. There are many restaurants nearby. The hotel is located on the 4th & 5th floors of a building that also holds two other hotels. The rooms were basic but clean and did have a mini fridge which was nice. You could get the remote for the AC and for the TV by putting down a 5 Euro deposit for each which was returned when you left. We didn't bother with the TV though since it was high on the wall and tiny. The only complaint I have, and it was bothersome, was that there was a persistent sewer smell emanating from our bathroom. It ebbed and waned depending on time of day. They did have a plumber come look at it but it wasn't fixed while we were there. They also offered to move us on day 2 of a 3-day stay but we decided to stay put because we would have had to pack up everything and then wait until late in the day to get another room. With the bathroom door closed and the window open it wasn't so bad. Also, we had requested a twin bedded room which was clearly on my reservation but when we arrived they had a double room for us. They were fully booked so they couldn't switch us and claimed it was the fault of the reservation center which was in another location. I did book through the hotel's own website. Fortunately it worked out because it was a queen-size bed which we were fine with, but that is not always the case.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, tiny room, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidTraveller777
Reviews.Content: Very clean and new. Pictures look way better than hotel, but it's pretty nice. Breakfast gives everything you need. Yogurt,meat,cheese,bread,cake,juice,fruit,etc. 1 min walk from Termini.Shops, food, everything. Extremely convenient. Nice supermarket at P. Santa Maria Maggiore. Area awful but no problem, always busy. I felt very safe. Go a few blocks over and it's fine. Single room was smallest I'd seen! 6ft across. WiFi keeps disappearing. VERY inconvenient. Staff is aware but don't seem to know how to fix.Staff very good. Elevator usual Italian style, small and slow, but better than walking up 5 flights with a suitcase. You have to buzz to get in, which is good in this area. Secure. Reception is on 4th floor. Elevator is on right up 8 stairs. Deposit of 5EUR for remote for TV and AC. Windows excellent, keeps out the noise. I was at the back so it was very quiet anyway. If you are a large person, the single room is not for you! Overall, very good. Very overpriced at 90Eur per night for single room

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: rwbinnyc
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Scott House. You can roll your luggage easily from the train station as its just around the corner, and within walking distance of many tourist sites. The building does not look like a hotel, it looks like an office building. The elevator is very small and claustrophobia-inducing. What makes this hotel worth the effort is: the location, the relatively low price, and the basic clean rooms. The front desk clerk was welcoming, and for a night or two in the center of Rome, its an affordable alternative to expensive full service hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: ange770
Reviews.Content: I found Scott House to be a very basic but clean, modern hotel which suited my needs perfectly. It is in an excellent location right next to the Termini station. My single room was small but clean with a bed, desk and chair. There is a tv in the room and you have to put down a 5 euro deposit to obtain a remote control for the tv and the air con unit (Rome was very hot during my visit so this was essential!!!). There was also a small fridge in the room with a minibar, with very reasonably priced drinks. I found this very handy. Breakfast I found was very good with a small but varied selection of foods such as bread, cheese, yoghurts and lovely croissants. Definitley enough to set you up for the day. My only gripe was that my room was right next to the reception so you could hear all the noise of people checking in/out from quite early in the morning. The area around the hotel is very busy as you would expect around a main train station, but at no time did i feel unsafe. It was very close to the main bus stations and metro if you needed it. I would recommend this hotel and enjoyed my stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: SkippyGuildford
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights during July this year and I was very impressed with the hotel. It is very clean and in a great location with all the major attractions within a 15 minute walk. The staff were very friendly, knowledgable and happy to answer any questions. The rooms were quite small, but clean and had everything that you would need in them, and they had air conditioning. The breakfast was good and served in a quiet room overlooking the road. I will definately be staying there again when I return to Rome

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: yvette79
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel for a short touristic stay. Good staff, everything else is average.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: miska2000
Reviews.Content: spent 2 nights at the Scott House, a block from Termini station with easy connections to Fumencino and Civitavecciahia. The hotel is in a 5 story building with a different hotel on each floor. The Scott House is on 4 and 5 reached be a small elevator. It looked like it recently had been remodeled as the halls/walls of the common area where covered in white marble giving it a very clean look. The room consisted of a bed, chair, A/C, phone and TV. The TV only had Italian stations, but we didn't spend much time there. The floor was covered with white marble. The bathroom was a decent size, also marble. The wierd thing abou the bath was the the shower was not contained and the water just poored on the floor with a slight slant to a small drain...which makes for a very WET bathroom at times and must be nightmare for housekeeping...but that's how the baths in the oher rooms were also. They had a standard european breakfast, meats, cheeses, eggs, fruit. It's was a budget hotel that I would rate at very good due to the clean, modern apperance. This is not your basic American budget hotel, no lobby

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kromanovs
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights in August with our child. The room was quite small, but clean and comfortable. Air conditioning, TV, bathroom equipment - everything worked well. The continental breakfast doesn't offer a wide variety of food, but gives you a good start with some muesli, bread, cheese, ham, croissant and coffee. The hotel is very close to the Termini (central railway and metro station) - so it's easy to reach it from Fuomicino airport and it's convenient to use metro to get around the city. The area around the hotel is packed with small pizzerias, cafes, etc. - so it's not a problem to eat nearby. There's also one of major Rome basilicas (St. Maria Maggiore) just few blocks down the street. Basically, this is a very good choice if you're going to Rome and don't want to stay inside the room all the day.

Reviews.Title: “Across from train station.”
Reviews.Author: happycat22
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in June. It was great to be able to jump on the metro to get around the city and see the sites. The room was clean and big enough. We slept well and the breakfast was perfect. This hotel was a good value for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you don't like weird odors”
Reviews.Author: mbalass
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome solo and after hours of scouring the web for a decent B&B I went with this hotel after reading the (mostly) positive/decent reviews and looking at the website which made everything look really nice. As soon as I walked in the room, I knew it wasn't going to be a great stay. The worst part was the odor in the room...there was some kind of sewage problem and the bathroom just stank to high heaven. There was a very harsh odor of bleach or whatever they tried to use to mask the sewage odor coming from the bathroom. The beds are reasonably comfortable (two twins in my room) and the TV was OK. No internet in the rooms. The size of the room was good. Hotel staff was nice and helpful. I didn't like the fact that they request you to leave your room key behind when go in and out, which I didn't bother doing. The location was OK only because it is literally steps away from the Termini station...really convenient. But it wasn't all that close to the main attractions in Rome and the neighborhood was a bit sketchy. The best hotspots for travelers seemed to be close to the Trevi Fountain area. Was not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the hotel was great and was near to transport link”
Reviews.Author: resetsony
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 4 at the hotel which was very resonable for the time we went. The room we stayed in was on the roof of the hotel we use the elevator to go part way then we have to walk a few steps up but once we reach up we were secluded since that was the only room on that floor. Room was recently refurbished and was in good condition. The bed has two single bed in one room and a double bed in an adjouning room with the ensuite bath room in between. Room was of a good size and we did not felt crampt in it. We had a patio where we could site and relax if we want to, but was too busy visiting sites to do that. The only downfall was that the room did not have any curtains but because we were the only one on that floor we did not mind too much. Also the internet did not work while we were there and so could not use the courtesy computer to say check in for our flight. But internety shops are close by that are reasonable. The best thing about this hotel is that it is close to the main station Termini, which is about 5 mins walk and also there is lots of restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Gwaladar
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel with my father and we didn't encounter any problems at all (other travellers and other reviews don't say the same). The hotel area is really convenient if you need to take the train or the bus to Rome's both airports but it's true that it is not the nicest area in Rome (I suggest you to use the Google Street View function to find out how the area looks like). Let's say that it's a busy area, as the main train station and the main local bus station are just a 2 minutes walk from the hotel main door. By the way, the hotel is located in the 4th and 5th floors of an old building that has other hotels in other floors (there is an elevator). And although the area is busy and you will find all types of people, it is safe. In regards to the hotel, my father and I found it clean, comfortable and convenient. Rooms and en suite bathrooms are renovated and clean. Beds were comfortable and the room was spacious enough (it has also TV, a chair and a table, air conditioning and a wardrobe). Service was good enough: the room and the bathroom were cleaned everyday, and the breakfast (included in the price) was better than I expected after having read other reviews (breakfast is very important for me, so I was worried about how it would be). What we got for breakfast was: 1 good teacup or 1 coffee cup, 1 glas of fruit juice, 1 fresh croissant, 2 small packed toast, 1 piece of packed butter, 1 piece of packed marmelade, 1 piece of packed chocolate to spread on the toast or better inside the croissant, 1 yoghurt, 1 piece of cake and 1 fruit (banana or apple or pear). About the staff: we didn't have any problems at all with them although it is true that when you arrive, the first thing they do is to request the full payment of your stay (apparently this is how it works there). They also were helpful when we asked them for directions and means of transport, so we don't have anything to complain about. Finally let me say that this hotel was not my first option but when I started looking for accomodation in Rome, all places were already booked. So in the end I took this hotel and, fortunately, the result was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, good location but the reception staff really let this place down.”
Reviews.Author: I_am_de_La_Condamine
Reviews.Content: (If there were an option to give hotels half marks I would rate this 3.5 - 3 is a little harsh). The Scott House Hotel is on the forth floor of a massive tenement block 2 minutes from the central station, which is great for accessing all Romes tourist spots in a few minutes. On foot the Colosseum is around 20 minutes away - still perfectly reasonable. Four flights of stairs may be a bit daunting but there is a lift which makes getting your bags to your room an awful lot easier. Having read many other reviews of this hotel I can only presume that since they were written Scott House has had a refit since the rooms are now clean, bright and well maintained. The TV is small for the size of the room and you’ll have to leave a deposit before you can get your hands on the remote but honestly, who comes to Rome to watch TV? The beds were comfortable enough and although the rooms have AC it’s controlled solely from reception. It is effective but the only options are ON or OFF which tends to mean you wake up in the early hours shivering and thinking you’re back in England. The breakfast, which is included in the price of the room, is fairly minimal: just a Crossiant, a packet of miniscule melba toast and a glass of slightly suspect (and daily changing) fruit juice. If you’re cheeky enough though they’re pretty flexible - we managed to get an extra pastry or two on most days! The reason that I’m giving this hotel only 3 out of 5 is because of the staff: each and every time I went near reception I was plagued about giving them money. When I booked, several months previously, there was no mention that the payment should be made when we arrived so it came as a shock to us when we were asked to suddenly hand over some money. We withdrew the maximum allowance from an ATM (€250) and gave it to them as proof we wouldn’t run off without paying - this covered well over half the total price and more than the amount due for the length of time we had already stayed. The receptionist seemed quite happy with that but that night we were asked again to pay by another receptionist, and we had to go through the receipt book with her before she believed that we’d paid. Then on our way out of dinner the same receptionist wanted MORE money, saying we had two nights left to pay and that she was suspicous of us not having paid already. In another incident, I asked if I could get one page printed from the internet. The receptionist said it wasn’t possible, which is fair enough - they’re not a printers but the excuse he gave was that they couldn’t use the computer for anything other than work relating to the hotel, not even personal stuff. When we went out to get the information printed elsewhere he was sat there with his headphones on on Facebook. So much for not using it for personal reasons. The internet is available free, you just need to get an account made specifically for you, it’s pretty fast but you will have to have your own laptop with Wi-Fi if you want to use it as there isn’t a shared computer. Considering the price of some of the hotels in the area Scott House Hotel is reasonable, although not cheap by any means. There are plenty of restaurants in the area and you couldn’t get much closer to the station without sleeping on the tracks so its location is ideal. I would suggest this place to someone wanting an extended stay in Rome and not looking at becoming bankrupt, but do be wary of the staff - they could really do with a lesson or two in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A last resort hotel by Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: SingaporePoppet
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last resort when we landed in Roma on the first night of the Icelandic volcanic ash incident and most hotels were full. It's central location by Termini Station is probably it's only winning point, given the room was cheaply furnished (complete with cheap bed and bedding) and we were met at the reception during check-in by 2 young prostitutes, who were just dropping off a room key at reception. The noise from the many bars and lively station nightlife can be heard from the hotel rooms, located on the 4th and 5th floor of an old, run-down building that was home to several other small, seedy-looking hotels. The breakfast served was above average (albeit mass produced and served on plastic trays) and offered good Italian coffee.

Reviews.Title: “I Was Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: AuntyBarby
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review while looking out of my little balcony at the Scott House. When we arrive we were tired from our flight from Palermo and the trip on the train,. We did not know where we were when we came out of the Termini and so dragged our suitcases for about 10 blocks. LOL. When I look to the right I can see the train station. We just came out of the wrong doors. If coming by train, exit the station close to the end where the city buses are. We are literally 2 blocks away. This is not an impressive hotel. It is housed in a building with other hotels and businesses. The "lobby" is on the 4th floor. The lift is small and looks a little scary but once you get used to it it is fine. The rooms are SMALL and the beds are low to the ground. You have to open the door to the shower to bend over and pick up the soap. But it is clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, There is TV and internet and it is in the heart of the city. You can catch a bus to anywhere right outside your door...almost. When I first saw it I did not like it at all but it grows on you. The breakfast is simple but good. I( would recommend this place but The Ritz it is not... We are out every day and have spent very little time here in the room, so who needs the Ritz?

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrjonb
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, staff was very nice and helpful, and a convenient location. They even fixed us breakfast-to-go when we had to leave for the airport at 3:30am.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: mrgAmes_IA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Scott House near the Termini in Rome. Our stay at this establishment was the worst part of the trip. We wanted something reasonably priced with basics; for the most part, that is the Scott House. However, during our three-day stay, two of the basics were not met--there was no hot water for showers and the internet service was only good if you had your own computer as their guest computer was said to be either not working or locked in the breakfast room which was open only during breakfast. The breakfast was nice. I wouldn't write a poor review on these two problems alone as I try not to let such things upset my travels. It was the check out that was a total nightmare and that coupled with the above problems, brings me to writing a poor experience complaint; at check out, they overcharged and refused to amend even after I showed them the email (hard copy) confirmations that I carried with me. After an hour of arguing and trying to get them to live up to their agreement, I left paying the overcharged amount. Further because of this dispute, we missed our train to Florence which had to be rebooked, etc. I would not recommend the Hotel Scott House to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awful and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: RKD314
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was terrible, but the most awful part is that I was paying 100 euros a night for it. I've stayed in 2 star hotels in major European cities before--Amsterdam, Paris, Geneva--and had better rooms for half the price. My experience involved three rooms: 402, 403, and 404. We were with my parents who were in 402. We were given 403, but asked to be switched and got 404. 402: It was sparse. The only furniture was a bed, 2 night stands, and a built in closet with a bar so high my average-height mom couldn't hang her clothes up. There was no rug on the floor, and the floors were not particularly clean (the sheets and towels were clean at least). The "queen bed" was 2 twin beds pushed together. There was not even a toilet paper holder in the bathroom. The toilet is uncomfortably close to the wall. 403: The worst hotel room I've ever seen. The bathroom is arranged such that a person over 5'3" couldn't possibly find room to sit on the toilet, your knees would hit the wall. There was mold growing on the wall above the shower, lots of it. Again, the "queen bed" was 2 twins. No rug and again dirty floors. There was a desk in this room. Again, no toilet paper holder. 404: The best one out of the three, but not enjoyable to stay there. The queen bed was an actual queen. No rugs, dirty floors. Furnished more than the other rooms--bed didn't look like a prison cot, there was a place to put luggage, a wardrobe, a desk. The bathroom was not clean. It was covered in soap scum and felt slimy. The shower curtain was brown at the bottom and looked filthy. The shower doesn't drain well, and if you take a shower it's very easy to flood not only the bathroom, but half the room in the process. At least you could sit on the toilet, but again, no toilet paper holder. This room also got a lot of noise from the street. In all the rooms, the television is extremely tiny and too high to reach by hand. A remote control will cost you a 20 euro deposit. Air conditioner cannot be controlled by the guest; you have to call the front desk and ask them to turn it on/off. There is wireless internet, though. Staff: The staff running the front desk were extremely polite and helpful. No problem there whatsoever. The breakfast staff was very rude. Breakfast: Pathetic. Croissant + coffee. Right next door there's a cafe that sells the same thing for 1.50 euro. If you MUST be right by the train station, stay across the street for about 30 euro a night more. In town (and closer to attractions) much better deals can be found.

Reviews.Title: “Bring a bio hazard suit!”
Reviews.Author: MissPuffK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only and couldn't wait to get out of there. I booked a budget room as we were arriving at 10pm and had to leave first thing in the morning. In retrospect we would've been better off paying and extra $30 for a decent room. The location is 3 mins from Termini Station, but on the dodgy south side. Staff were pleasant enough, however the room was so atrocious we couldn't sleep. The minute we walked in the smell of mould was overwhelming, There is no ventilation in the bathroom and we could see visible mould growing all over it. I wore thongs (flip-flops) in the shower out of fear of catching something and we were too scared to eat the breakfast that was included for fear of the hygiene standards. Save yourself the pain and spend a tiny bit more! Your lungs will thank you!

Reviews.Title: “everything else is OK but for the size of room .....”
Reviews.Author: sumamura
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a quad room from 5th / 9th sep 2009. location is simply great - the staff is friendly .... we spent very little time in the room but if someone is planning to relax .... he must look for another option. generally we had a good experience as we were 4 friends ..... for a family .... one could think otherwise ...... a great value for money option at a strategic location ......

Reviews.Title: “Good location for those with early morning flights; decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: brandspands
Reviews.Content: This hotel was decent. The rooms were comfortable, clean and nice. A lot of the guide books we read recommended against staying near the Rome train station, but this actually worked to our advantage. Rome was our last stop on our trip, so by the time we reached here, we had collected extra bags of souvenirs, so it was nice to walk just two blocks from the station to our hotel. We also had an early morning flight out of FCO airport, and being near the train station was key to catch the 3:45 a.m. Cotral bus to the airport. Catching the bus was free - the bus driver didn't end up charging us the 7 euro per person rate (versus paying a taxi 50 euros at that hour since no other form of transportation is open). Being near the station was great – this is the only place where both lines on the metro stop. A lot of the public buses also stop at the train station as well, making it a little easier to get around the city. The hotel room had a television and fairly large closets to store things. Breakfast was sufficient – coffee and tea with a croissant and crackers. The hotel allows guests to use the internet for free, up to 30 minutes a day. The hot water did go out for a bit, but the hotel resolved it in about 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “1 1/2 BLOCKS FROM TRAIN, BUS & SUB STATION & MARKET NEXT DOOR”
Reviews.Author: AWLHELPTOURSINC
Reviews.Content: What a great place for 50 EUROS. Anita very nice and her mom cleans the place all day long! Secure place to stay on 3rd floor with views of the street. She has plenty of tourist info and best yet is MARIO'S resturant right down the street! Super Mario spent many years in New Jersey before returning home to Italy. Has great specials every night and speaks 5 languages. The market is 2 doors away ! Just don't try to do any laundry in Rome because it cost me almost USD 10.00 for only one load wash/dry! Take the train from the airport and walk right to this hotel. Every day it was so easy to get around Rome by walking 1 1/2 blocks back to the train station. That is where the subway and bus lines meet. Anita has all the info on tourist sights you would need and which bus or subway line to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak777
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is the best part--we liked that it was close to the termini station. This was convenient when we were coming in from the airport as well as during our stay. Rome has an A and B line and the termini station is at the crossroads so you can basically go any way the underground goes without having to transfer. We didn't feel unsafe at all (we accidently missed the last metro car one night and had to walk all teh way back and felt way safer here than we would in our native San Francisco). The room was definitely small (smaller than it appears on the website) but my husband and I didn't spend much time in the room anyway. It was a bit noisy but we got used to it by our second or third night. The staff was very friendly and although the breakfast was minimal, they provided great service while you ate. They were very welcoming when we arrived and very accommodating with any requests. We stayed here at teh beginning and end of our trip. At the end, they had overbooked the hotel so they sent us across the street to another nicer hotel (Hotel Aphrodite?). While it was slightly inconvenient to have to move, the staff at both hotels made it as easy as possible. My biggest concern when staying at a hotel is cleanliness and this hotel was definitely clean.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, definitely no luxury; good for student groups”
Reviews.Author: Elenloth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Scott House for 7 nights on April 2008 as a member of a student group. I think this hotel is very good for larger groups who don't intend to spend much time in their rooms - you can get really cheap prices at this hotel if you are ready to share a small room with many people. I was staying in a room with 4 other girls and although there wasn't much space to move from our beds we were quite happy with our room. The staff was very friendly and spoke good English. Breakfast wasn't wonderful, but it was sufficient and the staff in the breakfast room was very friendly and helpful, ready to pour you more coffee the minute you emptied your cup. Rooms were clean, new fluffy towels were brought every day and the sheets changed. Although the street where the hotel is is quite noisy our room, at least, was very quiet and peaceful. The location is very good, maybe a minute from the main railway-, metro- and bus station Termini. The area is real tourist trap though, so be prepared to meet lots of street vendors, some of which might be quite insistent. I don't think the area was particularly seedy or dangerous though, as some have said in their reviews. I felt quite safe walking in the streets near the hotel with my girl friends, also late at night. Downsides were the elevator (made horrible, scary noise and was very slow) and the thin walls - when we were standing in our shower we could hear our friends' conversation in the room next door. Overall I think that this hotel was good value for money and I'll definitely stay there again when I next go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “central location - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: frenchconnection01
Reviews.Content: For the cheap price you pay the rooms are fine,double room 2 beds ensure a little bit of space insead of a single room. Overheating meant had to sleep with windows open and its very noisy outside, but the central location next to Termini is why you come here, night buses are handy and good links to airport. Rooms vere clean bathroom functional but small, beds comfortable...even had wifi. If you are not going to spend much time in a hotel and more time with the marvellous splendours of Rome then this otel is perfect for you. Location is also a downpoint as the area is a area of frequent comings and goings and beggers and probably drug dealers, but this is a capital city...if you come from London, Paris this won't be a problem for you, vut might be if you come from a small town.

Reviews.Title: “2 Completely Opposite Experiences!”
Reviews.Author: rainbowstripe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for four nights at the beginning of our Italian adventure, and another two at the end. Scott House Hotel Rome is in a very good location, and is value for money - it's easy walking around Rome from this location, and is literally 1or 2 minutes walk from the main railway station. However we were given two completely different rooms on each occasion. On our first four nights here, the room was generous in size, the bed reasonably comfortable (though made from two singles - this appears to be normal in budget hotels) and the bathroom adequate. We stayed on the first floor of the hotel, which is the 4th floor of the building. On our return to the hotel, we were given a room on the 5th floor of the building (second floor of the hotel). This room was completely different from the first, though the same price was paid. It was definitely a lot smaller. The two mattresses the double bed was made up from were completely different in height and softness, and they separated from each other multiple times during the night. The shower in the bathroom was missing a portion of it's door and the water sprayed out from the side of the shower head and pretty much everwhere. We didn't complain as we were too tired and just wanted to enjoy our last two days in Rome without too much fuss, but the quality between the rooms is obviously varied. I would stay here again if I could be guaranteed a room on the 4th floor of the building, the staff were very friendly and the breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Rmurro
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have been at Scott House last October. Actually we didn't see no advantage to stay there. Although it is near from termini, the location is not good. The neiborhood is quite noise, dirty and seems not so safe. Talking about the hotel the furniture of the rooms are very old and simple. The TV is very small. There's no air conditioning and the shower was very bad. The breakfast is absolutely simple. There's no buffet system. The waiter brings you one piece of bread and offers some coffe or milk. You have no option to choose any kind of fruit, cheese, chocolate and all the stuffs normally served in a hotel breakfast. By the way the price is not so cheap compared to others hotels in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Awful change”
Reviews.Author: Koxx
Reviews.Content: That hotel is awful. Dreadful smell, plastic doors, nasty decoration, shower « on WC floor » … We arrived too late to change or refuse that room (sent by another hotel - 4you). We wanted to have a good time in Rome last week-end, and that hotel was a big mistake. It was very terrible.

Reviews.Title: “close to Termini but...”
Reviews.Author: tennisbuff5
Reviews.Content: The biggest advantage to staying at the Hotel Scott House is its location... just a block and a half from the Termini, albeit through a somewhat seedy part of the city. Its position on the 4th level (each of the other levels are taken by other "hotels" in the building) makes it difficult to manage the stairs carrying 2 or more suitcases if the lift is not available. However, the biggest downside is the street noise... almost impossible to sleep with the window open, even when just cracked slightly for some air. There is a bus stop outside and the street car line corners near the property... they both operate most of the night and make a good rest out of the question. Of course, the sound of the scooters is ubiquitous both day and night. The continental breakfast is spartan, at best. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel and would not stay there again. I have found others much better in the same price range. It is, at most, a 2* property and pricey for what you get (E98 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: alexInSydney
Reviews.Content: While the location for this place is great and the price is pretty good it was let down by several factors. 1. The room had a distinct odour which came from the bathroom so had to ensure the door was closed while sleeping. 2. There was no water pressure in the bathroom so the showers was terrible 3. Also the clasp for the shower head was broken so had to hold the shower head in my hands. 4. The breakfast was minimal and the same everyday 5. While the staff were friendly and spoke very good english they could not answer questions like how long does it take the shuttle to get to the airport. Things I would expect any basic concierge to know. 6. The mattress was thin and hard as a rock. I in all honesty could not recommend this place to someone to stay for that price. Think you can get a better deal elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Dodgy but ok for a night!”
Reviews.Author: Aussie81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Scott House just for one night after landing in Rome as we needed to get to Rome Termini early the next morning for a train. If it weren't for the closeness to the station I would never stay at this hotel again! Negatives were: - You aren't allowed to control the air conditioning unit in your own room! You have to call reception and they come up to adjust the air con (mind you this was in the middle of summer when Rome was about 33 degrees outside!). The girl on reception seemed very reluctant to turn the air con to 24 degrees and increase the fan speed! Quite hilarious. - The shower is an absolute dribble coming out of the showerhead. Well, that was the case in our room anyway. You had to practically run around the shower to get wet! - Food at breafkast looked pretty awful...we skipped it and decided to get something at the station instead!

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: waran187
Reviews.Content: Stayed in August 2008. Pros : Very Good location.Near to the Termini station. Staff helpful.Elevator available.Bathroom was clean and well maintained.Good value for money. Cons : Bathroom was bit too small.Air-conditioning very poor.Same breakfast everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great !!”
Reviews.Author: Spide
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Scott House 4 times over the past 10 years and have only ever had good experiences. All rooms are really clean and well equipped. The location is great, just two minutes from the station which is handy if you are arriving by train or taking the bus from the airport which will drop you there. The breakfast is substantial and the staff are very polite and helpful. If you want to stay in Rome on a budget but get more for your money then I really recommend the Hotel Scott house.

Reviews.Title: “Euro Teen Bulk Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lprtex
Reviews.Content: They rent to groups of Teens from Europe that run up and down the halls/stairs. You will never sleep past 630 am due to the noise. The single rooms are smaller than my walk in closet. It was shown as a Hotel in Spartacus guide but the Hotel does not allow guests from outside or even other Hotel guests to visit anyones room. I cannot recommend this to anyone except for the basic bed and not a good bed at that.

Reviews.Title: “very good, secure and personal touch, we love la signora and Mikel”
Reviews.Author: zoribanks
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a good albergo near the Termini Station m y daughter and I, and we found this joyful man Mikelo from Rumania that works there cleaning. The room was 50 euros, very clean , near everything,and very secure. One night a friend of us came and they didn't let him get in the room which was perfectly allright with us because that means that no other client was getting a stranger in the place. We were very fond of the lady in charge and Mikelo. Very clean rooms and bathrooms

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: jubjub54
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a great week in Rome. Stayed at this location ,a stones throw from Termini Station. I travelled with my 8 yr. old grandson. We were picked up by Rome shuttle Limousine from Da Vinci,excellent service We checked in at 21.30 and were given room 601,which I named the penthouse, which is on the roof of the 5 story building. The room consisted of 2 rooms and a shower and toilet. The bedroom had a double bed and the sittingroom 2 single beds. The room was very comfortable if basic.There was a television with one english channel,CNN,and one music channel.The heating was very good as it was a bit chilly in feb .Rooms were cleaned every day with a fresh change of bedding. Overall I was very happy with both the hotel and staff,whom were very helpful. There are only 2 downsides one, the breakfast is meagre and if you require a second cup of coffee you must pay for it.Two, tea making facilities would make a great difference. There are 3 McDonalds in spitting distance of the hotel,2 in termini station and around the corner the third,which I found not too clean. We decamped every morning to the mcdonalds downstairs in the termini station for breakfast ,good value.I must also say that the coffee and brioche at 1 euro 60 was excellent value. Whilst the termini area has its down and outs and other characters we did not feel in anyway fearful but I must say I lost my wallet there,I do not know if it was pickpocketed or not.There is also a large police presense there. In summary I would use this hotel for its proximity to station and accommodation. TIP. pay cash and get 5% discount

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: aelleg
Reviews.Content: The Scott House is conveniently located near the Termini Station, so all the major sites and museums are very easily accessible. The rooms themselves are tight, but well kept and clean. The free breakfast was a nice perk- a fresh pastry, crackers, and orange juice. Still, this accomidation is more suited to students than families travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: lucyboz
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a basic, very clean accomodation on a budget, then this hotel is fine. We had a family room with four beds and an on-suite bathroom for about £70 a night. It also had air-conditioning and a small breakfast included. The rooms were cleaned properly every day and we were happy with what we got for the price. It's very close to the main train station in a poor area of Rome but our room was quiet despite its location. Luxurious it isn't!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: probablestars
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about staying in this 'hotel' was that I was staying with my friends. Otherwise it was a disaster. The bathrooms are terrible. We had no hot water, the shower sprays everywhere, and there is barely any room to stand in. At least there was a bidet, I guess. The towels are rough and you aren't given enough, nor were we given enough toilet paper. We had three beds squashed together. Everything looked clean, at least. The television didn't work and the air conditioner was noisy and put up much too high (you have to contact reception every time to have it turned off - no adjustments possible - so you either die from heat or freeze to death). Although they promise internet, there is none. If you ask, they tell you to find somewhere on the street. Being close to Termini is convenient, but it's a terrible area. They say that before a certain time there is breakfast, and after a certain time you can have a croissant and coffee. Don't bother to wake up early. The only extra thing you get at breakfast is a zwieback. The lift is disastrously slow or not working at all, so you almost always end up walking up 4-5 flights of stairs to get to your room. Worst of all, a friend visited us in the room one afternoon for a few hours. The next day, the manager and receptionist knocked on our door, threatening to kick us out and alleging our friend had slept there. We were told we needed to pay for an extra person!! We were then told that the hotel had a totally bizarre rule that visitors are not allowed to be in a guest room for more than 5 minutes. If a visit lasts longer than 5 minutes it must be conducted in the breakfast room. This is weird and prison-like. We actually ended up fighting with the very rude receptionist. Although she came round in the end it was far from pleasant. I would defnitely not stay here. Your sanity and enjoyment of Rome are worth a few more euros, and there are better hotels. It's just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: ScottVancouver
Reviews.Content: Scott house was our Hotel for 3 nights this July. The reception people were fine but did not go out of their way to help. The breakfast was adequate but the male staff member was rude and un -welcoming.The neighbourhood was scary so think twice about staying there. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “just OK”
Reviews.Author: soniiia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our last night in Rome. We splurged on our first three nights and wanted somewhere more affordable to stay. The termini location was ideal as we were leaving Rome by train the next day. First of all, the hotel is OK. The rooms appear clean, although with the dim lighting, I doubt any uncleaness could be detected. We got there at 11:00AM and were told that the room was not ready. We left the luggage and went for a one hour walk. Upon our return to the hotel, the room was still not ready. Although we could clearly see the staff cleaning the room next door to ours. Our neighbours were not checking in until much later. We had to wait in the breakfast room for another hour. There was also no internet in the hotel, contrary to the internet advertisement. The bathroom was fine, breakfast was OK (don't expect too much and you'll be happy).

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: kingmack91
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was that it was right next to the train station. Otherwise the beds were uncomfortable, the rooms were really really loud and it is full of tour groups, the lift is the slowest thing I have ever seen, the breakfast was bad. Overall one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed. Don't waste you time!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: berry2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there during our vacation in Rome. For a European hotel, the room we got was fairly spacious and even had a balcony. Everything was clean and being close to Termini Station was great. I felt safe in the area but a lot of unsavory men hung out on the other side of the street. Not a big deal, we just didn't walk there. Breakfast was the same thing every morning, a crossaint, some weird packaged toast, and pineapple juice. It was fine though since it was free.

Reviews.Title: “NOT for Americans!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustering
Reviews.Content: room was clean, breakfast was fine, can't beat the location (really close to public transportation)...HOWEVER...if you value your privacy at all do NOT stay here. let me just say the man at the front desk keyed himself into the room at the most *inopportune* moment, if you catch my drift. it was three in the morning and i mean, he just walked right in! maybe this kind of thing is okay in europe, but i as an american was simply appalled. no amount of apologizing can fix a thing like that, not even cutting some of the bill (which they did not offer to do anyway). so be forewarned!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: CatSmith2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in some ways more like a hostel but that is reflected in the price, which we found was pretty good value. The location is excellent, near the Termini train station and near the main bus station. We stayed during winter time&it did get a little chilly in the rooms during the night (they have a bizarre obsession with opening all windows throughout the hotel during the day) but if requested the hotel will provide extra blankets. The rooms are basic but clean and Rome is such a wonderful city to explore you are hardly in it anyway. Stay here if you want cheap and cheerful accomodation!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful - Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Anthol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here eight years ago and thought after reading recent reviews that we expected too much... so we gave it another try three weeks ago. It was worse than we remembered! Yes it's only two stars and yes the pokey old rooms are clean, but the service is a nightmare and will destroy your enjoyment of this amazing city. The staff are rude. dismissive, curt, inappropriately unprofessional and untrustworthy. Their information on local activities and places is dodgy, and when they cheated us out of tour bus money they told us they couldn't do anything because they do not keep receipts or financial records! All this along with the added bonus of a lobby full of loitering prostutes and piles of garbage outside the front door. When we checked out we did not even get a thank you or a goodbye - in short we felt like fools because there are so many wonderful hotels in Rome that are the same price or even cheaper. Avoid the 'Scott House' at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good, though a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for four nights. The reason for chosing it was the proximity to the central station of Termini. It was very easy to find. Although the first impression when you enter the building (where there are at least six hotels) is not very good, when you get to the reception desk everything changes. It is very clean and tidy and everyone is very helpful and kind. We were a family of three and the room was a double one so it didn't turn out to be very spacious for us but it was air-conditioned, which in July in Rome is highly important. Very good impression although it is a two-star hotel. The price was a bit high in my opinion, as after our stay here we went to a three-star hotel in the north part of the city and it was much cheaper. I suppose the price responds to the fact that it is very well located and everything is handy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Value”
Reviews.Author: djm0027
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of homework before booking my Hotel in Italy from reading past stories. So unlike a lot of people I pretty much knew what to expect from a 2 star Hotel in Rome. I had good expectations and they actually were met and exceeded them. I had a pleasant stay at this Hotel (9 nights) It is a good hotel for someone on a budget like myself. I only had the breakfast twice the first morning and the morning that I departed. It is not an American Breakfast people, its simple, coffee and a croissant. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, with just a little bad.”
Reviews.Author: MPLSKevin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Scott House is located about 3 blocks from Termini station, in the heart of Rome. As such, the neighborhood is loud at all hours of the day, the residents are a little dodgy, and there is an ample amount of graffiti and garbage on the streets. In short, it's everything you'd expect from a slightly run-down neighborhood in a major, modern city. As long as you have a little common sense and some self-confidence, you'll have no problems staying here. And in exchange for these manageable problems, you'll find yourself in a centrally located, inexpensive hotel, that has easy access to mass transit, termini station, and all sorts of great ethnic (non-Italian) places to eat within walking distance. The rooms were a decent size, and very clean. The staff spoke English and was polite, but they were also 18 - 22 years old and not native to Rome, so sometimes their advice was a little dodgy. If you're staying in Rome on a budget (something that's not easy to do), I'd recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Scott House is the worst experience I have had at any hotel stay in my life. They have false advertising on their website. For example there is no internet and the free breakfast is not a breakfast. The breakfast consisted of a stale crossant. Out of the 3-4 front desk employees one was helpful. The others provided false information and answered questions about the city of Rome as if they were guessing which clearly they were. The stay was 98 euro a night which is absolutely ridiculous. You have to leave your key at the front desk and we were reassured that our things were safe but anyone could have walked up and requested our room key. They would not only have access to our room but to our safe which contained the most important information such as our passports, money and credit cards. Unsafe is an understatement as far as the neighborhood where it was located. As a female I have never felt so unsafe in my life and coming from NY that is pretty bad. I did not feel safe at all walking down the street after dark which prevented us from being able to tour the night life in Rome. Overall I would not recommend a stay at Hotel Scott House for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: counselme
Reviews.Content: Based on some of the reviews here, the Hotel Scott House seemed like a reasonable place to stay our last night in Rome. We wanted a place close to the Termini station since we had an early morning flight out and we weren't going to be spending much time in the hotel since we were coming back up from Sorrento the day we checked in. We were very pleasantly surprised by the room, the hotel, the front desk staff, etc. We had stayed in that are earlier in the week at a different hotel, so we knew what to expect. Yes, it is a bit seedy, but we never felt unsafe. Yes, it was noisy since we were on the street side, but when we closed the windows, it was really pretty quiet. The room was clean, the bed was big and comfortable, and the bathroom was fine. Plus the price was great. One note - if you book directly with the hotel rather than through an internet booking site and you pay cash, you will get a 5 euro discount off the room charge. I can't speak to their breakfast since we had to leave the hotel at 5:15 am, but everything else was prefectly fine.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it! Unsafe neighborhood to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: euro_tourist
Reviews.Content: First of all, they post on their website that they have free internet, they don't have any internet. You have to walk a block and pay, but don't forget to bring your passport with or you won't get on. The fees stated on their website are incorrect, and we found out on our stay that people staying in the same type of room were paying 4 euro less. Basically, they charge what they want to. I questioned it, but there was nothing I could do about it. They don't keep any change on hand when you pay (the night before you leave) so you'd better bring exact change or they will make you go out and get exact change at a nearby store. The neighborhood around the Termini is not safe at night. Esp. for two women travelers, which we were. In fact, the neighborhood during the day isn't much better, and having to deal with that each morning and night really put a damper on our trip. Additionally, you have to leave your key at the front desk when you come and go, and they just ask for your room number when you go to pick up your key. We could have asked for any room number and they would have given it to us. I asked how they know they are giving the right key to the right people who are staying in that room and not someone else just asking for our room key and they said, they keep track. But yet, they change front desk people every 3 hours and no one remembered what room we were staying in.. not even after being there 4 days and asking for our room key. By the way, the safety deposit box key is on the room key as well and is in your room. "Breakfast" is a crossant. Perhaps it was just the one day we tried it, but it was stale and hard. I could feel the springs of the bed on my back at night. I would not recommend anyone pay to stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Rome is noisy”
Reviews.Author: mackers1001
Reviews.Content: Like all the other reviews, I would praise for all the same qualities...however..like every hotel in Rome, noise is a big issue...the traffic goes all night and it is really loud...there are back rooms in this hotel, so when requesting a room, make sure you try to get one of these...The room numbers away from the street are 501, 502 and 503.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Scott House (an Aussie perspective)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Scott House hotel for three nights in December. We arrived at Termini station from the Ryanair bus and it took about 10 mins to walk to the hotel from there (crossing the whole of Termini station) and the exit is near platform 24. The area around the hotel and station is a bit dodgy, but we managed to find the hotel. The hotel is actually in a building which seems to have a different 'hotel' on each floor. Coming into the building you start to wonder what the hotel will be like upstairs. There is only one lift which works reasonably well. When we got to the Scott House late at night, we were told that the passports would need to be held for the night so that they could be checked in the morning. I had read from previous reviews that something like this could happen and apparently it is because the Italian police require this information. We were not happy to leave our passports there and so we had an argument. We reluctantly had to leave our passports there (or no room), however once we were in our room the guy at the front desk said he had rung the owner and photocopied the passports and that we could have them back. We later found out that it they only take the passports at night time (say after 11pm - 5am) because only the girls who work during the day are allowed to write the details down on the official forms. This seemed a little bit strange to us, but during the three days we could see that the same thing was happening to everyone. Apart from that, the hotel was very clean though definitely 2 star. For the price I think it is unbeatable. The included breakfast is pretty good, as is the location (but not the area). The rooms are very basic (with tea towels to dry yourself with)but clean. I would recommend staying here if you are on a budget (and don't let the passport issue put you off), and you want something that is clean, cheap and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean and well maintained place. Walking distance to most of the sites. Not in the nicest part of the city but felt perfectly safe as a single female even at night as in busy area of city 50 metres from main station and metro. Simple breakfast included in price and E5 discount per night for paying cash. All round excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Garybrum
Reviews.Content: Having ready some reviews about the Scott House Hotel in Rome, we were filled with some trepidation about our stay there, especially as we would be stuck there for 12 solid nights. We needn’t have feared, clean rooms, fresh towels every day, nice thick ones, heated (it was November), TV, Pleasant Staff, Safe, all in all a nice hotel. It is so well positioned right by the Main Train Station, (Termini), just a short walk to all the main sites, like the coliseum etc. Just one thing, there is no longer Internet at the hotel, they have had to stop it, because of some anti–terrorists law the government has introduced The Metro is a god send, so easy to use and cheap, get your tickets from the machine in the train terminus, and away you go. Be careful if using buses or metro that you have a ticket and that it has been validated. Some young American girls failed to do this and were waiting for some one to come round to sell them a ticket, instead the inspectors got on the bus and made them pay an instant €51 fine each, this applies even if you have bought a bus ticket but not validated it in the little yellow machines on the bus, so beware. You can’t buy a ticket on the bus!!!!, Ask at your hotel, they will put you right. The other thing to be aware of is the amount of pickpockets, it is rife. Be sure you only carry what you need for your day out and keep all valuables out of sight, you WILL get robbed if you don’t take care. We heard from others and saw for ourselves people getting robbed. Keep clear of the women with babies, they are masters at it. And thanks again to the staff at the Scott House Hotel, you made our Stay in Rome a Pleasant one. Gary Overton & Nigel Cummings

Reviews.Title: “Scott House is overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel upon arriving from Roma Termini around 10:00pm and was greeted by an unpleasant front office person. He insisted on keeping our passports, saying that it's regulation in Italy but we doubt him from the first minute. The front office person reluctantly returned our passports after being not able to contact the manager and making a lof of fuss. The nasty experience will be remembered always. There are better hotels around the area. Rooms and breakfast was very basis. Find another option if you intend to stay around the Termini area as there are loads of other hotels within walking distance. I would like to recommend a great chinese restaurant on Cavour Street.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: grandmanan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Scott House for three nights in July 05. Its close proximity to the Termini station was great for us as we used the trains and buses frequently. The room was small but adequate, and very clean. We had a double room which had two twin beds pushed together, a small tv mounted up near the ceiling and a small bathroom with shower, no tub. The a/c worked well although they often shut it off during the day when you are out so don't assume it's not working, just call the desk and they will turn it back on for you. The rooms have a safe as well(no charge) which is great for storing away passports, tickets and extra cash. The breakfast was quite basic but we honestly found it too hot to eat big meals anyways. We were thankful for the free internet access as we were able to keep in touch with home at no extra cost. All in all, would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good basic place to stay for a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peachesse
Reviews.Content: A good basic place to stay in the very centre or Rome, just 5 mins walk from the Termini. The staff were so helpful and friendly. It was great that there was a continental breakfast in the price served in a bistro type dining room; again service with a smile! We had a 3 bed room which was rather crowded but as we were there for only 2 nights and our aim was to sightsee it was fine, clean and airconditioned, had a small balcony and a TV too! For a 2 star hotel the price was very good and a discount of 5 Euros was offered per person if you paid in cash. After checking out we were able to leave our luggage in a secure room and had use of a bathroom. The hotel is situated on the 4th and 5th floors but there is a lift! Across the road there is an excellent and very reasonably priced pizza/pasta place. The rissotto was delicious! I would not hesitate to go to this hotel again if I was in Rome for a quick visit.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Witcat
Reviews.Content: Scott House is a 2* hotel on the 4th and 5th floor of a building with hotels on every floor. Not a good choice if stairs are a problem, though there is a lift. The Termini station area is good for buses/metro/trains, but I wouldn't let my girlfriend walk around alone at night (though it didn't seem THAT bad.) The front desk (4th floor - you buzz them to let you in from the street) is 24 hours so no worries about coming back late. English was well spoken at the desk. Rooms were nothing special, but fine. Our double bed was two single beds pushed together. The TV in the room had 9 channels, including BBC World and CNN. Breakfast was small - just a croissant and these things which were a cross between biscuits and toast, accompnied by orange squash and tea/coffee. But it was nice to have something there. There is a computer with Internet access available in the room where breakfast is served. When we came to leave there was a room where we could store our bags until we were about to depart, which was useful. Overall I had no complaints and enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mussolini would be proud.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The low point of our trip to italy in March 2003. DO NOT STAY HERE! It is a youth hostile in every way, but price. The hotels one saving grace was that because of its unwarrented popularity, it was booked up at the end of ourtrip when we retuned to Rome, so we had already made reservation at the Hotel Piemonte. THANK GOD!!!!!! We are not fussy travelers, who complain when aything doesnt measure up to the Hilton. We always go on the cheap, and the Scott was actually the most expensive place we stayed at in Italy, which makes these charges all the more serious. Even though we checked in after 4:00, we were told the room was not ready- some story about an electrician- and to come back in an hour, which we did. Then the story changed to a painter, and to come back later. When we finally were allowed into our room, there was no smell of paint, and I doubt an electrician had been there, as one of the two lights in the room had a burned out bulb. Because of the TV's location , mounted to the wall over the closet, I was forced to fork over a $10 (?!?!?) deposit for the remote, which didnt work, even after I changed the batteries. The towels were thinner than dish rags, and rationed, because when I asked for more, I was told that 2 was the most I could have (?!?!?). Despite the room's decor, no amount of sponge painting and Ikea furniture can make up for this dump's most serious, and depending on your age, health-threatening obstacle: The Scott occupies the 4th and 5th floors of a very large an old building that is serviced by a single elevator that only works occasionaly. We discovered this after the first of many long hikes up 4 flights of stairs, when we asked at the front desk and were told..."Sometime she work, sometime she not." And dont even think about asking for help with your luggage! A couple in their 50's was forced by the hotel to carry their own bags up four flights when the elevator "no work". They were already at the third floor before we found them, and offered to help, and the woman was terrified by the thought of having to climb the stairs all week. If you still insist on staying here, do not fall for the old trick: "The credit card machine is broken. You'll have to pay cash!". They tried this with us when I checked in. I refused, and the machine was "fixed" in ten minutes. We also wtnessed them pulling this on others the next day, and when we checked out. I don't know if they were stealing from the owners, hidding income from the government, or just avoiding the credit card fee, but it's a lousy trick to pull on a "guest".

Reviews.Title: “Best value, excellent location, cleanest ever”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust_Turca
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel from the internet and immediately booked it. The room seemed pretty big from the pictures but I had expected a smaller room since I had a single room. The room was very little but the bed was comfortable. The bathroom is fine, shower works excellently. There is air conditioning and in winter the heating is very good. The hotel has an excellent location, 3 minutes from the Termini Station. Also it is pretty safe, there is 24 hour reception and by the night time, there is a security person at the front desk. The room was sooo clean that I was impressed...My room was very quiet. The breakfast they serve is a little one, a cold croissant, some jam, butter and toast but it would suffice. There is also free internet use for the hotel guests. My trip was in December, so I had an excellent value of 30 EUR for a single room, paid cash. The only thing I disliked would be the staff. They seemed very unhappy, should the management make some increase in their salaries????

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read one or two bad reviews, I was a little nervous but I needn't have worried. The hotel was clean, comfortable and excellent value for money - certainly the best 2* I've stayed in. The only real problem was that the air conditioning was a little noisy, but I'd rather have the noise than the heat! I would certainly recommend this hotel and stay again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Men, It's not fair!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Scotte House in July 2004 for three nights. I made an online reservation almost one and half month ago(There were 2 or 3 single rooms available except mine). BUT BUT they canceled my reservation without my agreement two days before the day I was visiting their hotel. That was found out just because I happened to check my e-mail in Florence before visiting Rome. I called Hotel Scott House to find out what was going on, then they said THEY CANCELED my reservation because there was no room available any more. That was so obvious they failed to update their room availability online and double booked and canceled mine. The staff was so helpless, SO HELPLESS. Your credit card# is supposed to guarantee your reservation!. After all, they told me that I could only stay for a night, so I visited the hotel. Luckily I could secure the room for 3 night because someone didn't show up. (But if he or she did??) So, I don't recommend this hotel to you. And I won't be back to the hotel either. What kind hotel is that to cancel gest's reservation without an agreement. I can't trust this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a 28”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality hotel considering it is only a 2*, deserves higher rating. Clean, comfortable and very friendly staff. Close to all amenities on a street leading to the main railway station and bus depot.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, just steps away from all transports. Although it is a 2 star hotel and it was cheap, the Scott House also provided internet access, and the breakfast was included. The reception staff was there 24 hours and they were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: coolwater1
Reviews.Content: This was a good cheap hotel located very near the Termini Station. The room was clean and the reception staff very helpful. The free internet access was very handy.The people who have moaned about this hotel on this website should perhaps pay a bit more money and stay somewhere else if their standards are so high.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Scott House
HotelInfo.Address: Via Gioberti 30, 00185 Rome, Italy
